result.execSummary:
The defendant Angel E Sanchez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Angel E Sanchez was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Angel E Sanchez is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Angel E Sanchez was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Angel E Sanchez was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Angel E Sanchez was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Angel E Sanchez was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically anger management and cognitive interventions. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. No contact, directly or indirectly with the victim. No contact with any Wal Mart in Racine County during the term of probation. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law within 60 days of release from Racine County Jail and pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Defendant Angel E Sanchez in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Angel E Sanchez in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Leslie Johnson
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Parties have reviewed PSI. The State puts corrections and an addition to the PSI. The State does not agree with DOC and recommends 6 mos RCJ on Ct 3, Ct 4-6 mos RCJ consec, Ct 2 60 days RCJ, consec, Ct 1 - 18 mos IC, 18 mos ES - STAYED with 1 yr RCJ as a condition of probation.

BTC: Ct 1 - Total sentence is 3 yrs WPS bifurcated as 18 mos IC, 18 mos ES-STAYED. 3 yrs probation
         Ct 2 - 60 days RCJ consec to Ct 1, costs
         Cts 3 & 4:  - 4 mos RCJ, conc with each other but consec to Cts 1 & 2, costs

Conditions:
Ct 1 - 12 mos RCJ/CFTS
obey all rules and regs
costs
DNA sample w/in 60 days of release from RCJ & costs on Ct 1
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's
any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically anger management and cognitive interventions
FT emp

no contact with any Wal Mart in Racine County during the time of supervision

Defendant Angel E Sanchez in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Angel E Sanchez in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Katie Giebel.  Transcript filed: 02-03-2016 vw.
The State does not have rebuttal. The defense moves for directed verdict on the hate crime enhancer as well as CDTP. The State gives argument. BTC: The Court believes this is a jury question and the Court is satisfied that a directed verdict is not warranted in the hate crime enhancer.  Regarding the CDTP, there is sufficient evidence for a jury to find the deft guilty. Motions are denied.
Parties review jury instructions to be given by the Court.
Ms. Sommers gives closing arguments. Ms. Tran gives closing arguments. The Court instructs the jury. Alternate chosen, Oath #4 given. Deliberations begin at 11:45 am
Verdicts reached at 1:00 pm

Ct 1: Guilty w/o hate crime enhancer
Ct 2: Guilty
Ct 3: Guilty
Ct 4: Guilty
Ct 5: Not Guilty
Ct 6: Not Guilty

State moves for judgment on the verdict. Defense moves for judgment not withstanding the verdict. State asks that bond be revoked

BTC: Guity on Cts 1-4. Bond remains as set PSI ordered.

of Preliminary Hearing on 3-4-15
Ex #1-16.  ALL EXHIBITS ARE IN THE COURT FILE

Defendant Angel E Sanchez in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran and Mindy Nolan.  Defendant Angel E Sanchez in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Jury enters the courtroom, Oath #1 given. Introduction by the Court, information read. Ms. Sommers introduces self and members of her office as well as witnesses. Ms. Tran introduces self and members of her office as well as witnesses. Voir dire by the Court. Voir dire by Ms. Sommers for the State. Voir dire by Ms. Nolan for the defense. Parties exercise peremptory challenges. The jury is chosen. Ms. Nolan, for the defense, raises a Batson challenge. The State responds to the Court's colloquy. BTC: The Court is satisfied with the State's explanation of her strikes. 
The State submits a stipulation signed by all parties including the deft stipulating as to some of the elements that must be proven in this case; specifically in the 2014 CT case. The Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant regarding stipulation.  BTC: the defendant freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently entering into the stipulation. The Court instructs the jury. Oath #2 given. Ms. Sommers gives opening statements for the State. Ms. Tran gives opening statements for the defense. The State reads stipulation to the jury and marks it as Ex #1. State moves exhibit into evidence/received.
State calls Officer Benjamin Mieloszyk - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross xam by Ms. Tran for the defense. State calls Officer Patrick Albers - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross xam by Ms. Tran for the defense.

Afternoon Court Reporter: Maggie Techert.

The State calls JB - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #2-5; photos. State moves same into evidence/so received & published. State marks Ex #6-DVD of altercation from Youtube. Portion of the video played for the jury. Cross xam by Ms. Tran for defense. State calls Dr. Jennifer Liu- DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #9-Dr. Liu's report. Dr. Liu provides the Court and parties with additonal reports from additional ER visits by the victim. Defense objects to reports being admitted into evidence. Objection overruled-Ms. Tran voir dire's the witness.  State marks Ex #10-Additional reports. Cross xam by Ms. Tran. State moves Ex #9 & 10 into evidence. No objection/received. State calls RH - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #11 & 12 - DVD's of Walmart surveillance video. State moves #11 & 12 into evidence. Video played for the jury. Cross xam by Ms. Nolan for the defense. State rests. Defense moves to dismiss. BTC: The Court is satisfied the prima facia case has been met - motion to dismiss is denied. Defense indicates that deft wishes to testify. The Court conducts colloquy with deft regarding his right to remain silent and his right to testify. BTC: The defendant freely, knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently chooses to testify. Defense calls Officer    Defense marks Ex #7 & 8-photos. Defense marks Ex #7, 8, 13-16; photos. Defense moves said exhibits into evidence. The State does not object to #7 & 8, but objects to 13-16. All photos may be admitted into evidence but will only allow 2 of Ex #13-16 to publish. Defense asks to publish Ex #13 & 15/so published. Defense calls AS - DSAT. Direct by Ms. Tran for defense. Cross xam by the State. Defense rests.
Jury trial at 08-26-2015 08:30 am

Ms. Sommers put the final offer off the record. Ms. Sommers revoked said offer in May. The Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant. Defendant understands there is no offer on the table.
Jury enters courtroom, Oath #1 given. Ms. Sommers, for the State, introduces self and co-workers along with potential witnesses. Ms. Tran introduces self, Ms. Nolan and her co-workers along wth potential witnesses. Voir dire by the Court. Voir dire by the State. Voir dire by Ms. Nolan for the defense. 

Voir dire will be aborted for today. New panel will be brought in tomorrow.  Jury trial scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from ADA Sommers, re: request to adjourn.

Defendant Angel E Sanchez in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Angel E Sanchez in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.  Transcript filed: 01-12-2016 vw.
Parties are prepared to proceed, all discovery has been received. State's MIL are granted. No Daubert issues for either party. State's witnesses are all served and are available. All defense witnesses are served. No crime lab issues. Anticipated length of trial  is 1 1/2 days. 1 alternate, 5 strikes. The Court will give the following instructions; 50, 103, 148, 55, 58, 300, 140, 101. Ludwig just prior to voir dire.

Ct 1: 940.19(2)-Substantial battery-Intend bodily harm; Ct 2: 947.01(1)-DC; Cts 3 & 4: 946.49(1)(a)-Misd BJ; Ct 5: 943.01(1)-CDTP; Ct 6: 946.49(1)(a)-Misd BJ. No contact with the victim, JB (person, property, residence or family).   No contact with the co-defendant, TLS.  No contact with victim store, Walmart, except for restitution purposes.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
